[h1]Scootaloo's Review of Drift Horizon Online[/h1]

Greetings from the frosty expanse of HowlStrom! I'm Scootaloo, a 19-year-old school-age Pegasus pony, and an avid gamer. My experiences racing through the icy terrains of HowlStrom with the renowned Ice Wolf Clan, led by Alpha Kiba Snowpaw, have fueled my passion for high-speed pursuits. Today, I'm sharing my thoughts on "Drift Horizon Online" by JDM4iK Games and published by SA Industry.

[h2]The Icy Thrills of Drifting: A Comparison with HowlStrom's Winter Challenges[/h2]
As a native of HowlStrom, I find the concept of drifting on icy roads quite familiar. "Drift Horizon Online" offered a digital rendition of the adrenaline-pumping action I've experienced while soaring over frozen landscapes. The game's mechanics are intended to replicate the thrill of drifting, but how does it fare against the unpredictable and harsh conditions of HowlStrom?

[h3]Gameplay and Mechanics: Sliding Through Challenges[/h3]
Much like navigating the treacherous ice patches in HowlStrom, "Drift Horizon Online" requires skill and precision. The game's physics aim to provide a realistic drifting experience, which I found to be a mixed bag of excitement and frustration.

[i]Pros[/i]:
- The drifting mechanics are fun, providing an arcade-like experience that echoes the wild rides over HowlStrom's snowy dunes.
- Online multiplayer offers a chance to race against others, reminiscent of the friendly competitions within the Ice Wolf Clan.

[i]Cons[/i]:
- The game suffers from technical issues, including choppy gameplay and bugs that can abruptly end your racing streak, much like a sudden blizzard in HowlStrom.
- Limited customization options for cars, making it less engaging for those who love to personalize their rides.
- The penalty system for engine wear and tire wear feels restrictive, unlike the freedom of soaring freely over HowlStrom's landscapes.

[h3]Visuals and Atmosphere[/h3]
The night streets and graphics of "Drift Horizon Online" are commendable, but they lack the breathtaking beauty of HowlStrom's auroras and icy vistas. The game's visual appeal is somewhat dulled by its inconsistent light reflection and terrain issues.

[h3]Scootaloo's Verdict[/h3]
"Drift Horizon Online" offers a glimpse into the world of drifting, but it falls short of capturing the true essence of high-speed ice racing as experienced in HowlStrom. The game has potential but is hindered by its technical shortcomings and lack of depth.

[b]Rating[/b]: [i]6 out of 10 HowlStrom Snowflakes[/i]

In conclusion, while "Drift Horizon Online" provides an arcade-style drifting experience, it doesn't quite match the exhilarating and untamed spirit of racing in HowlStrom. For those seeking a casual drift racing game, it might be worth a try, but don't expect the wild, heart-pounding adventures of a Pegasus soaring over the icy world of HowlStrom.

This game... Is beautiful... The graphics are well made and smooth, the drift mechanics are smooth and silky and milky and quadrilky. I seriously wanted to cry while playing this game... Because... it is so... good... I love this game and I love Japan! I am japan! I go to japan! I eat sushi in japan! I drift cars in japan! This game was so immersive I started to drift irl. and I'm not talking in an automobile. I went full on drifty 100% of my life. I drifted out of bed this morning, I drifted onto the bus this morning, I drifted to school this morning, I drifted to class this morning, I drifted to my next class this morning, I drifted to my next class this morning, I drifted to my next class this morning, I drifted to lunch this morning, I drifted to my next class this morning, I drifted on the bus back home this morning, I drifted my way home this morning, I drifted into the dinner table this morning, I drifted to play gta5 this morning, I drifted as Franklin this morning, I drifted as Trevor this morning, I drifted as Micheal this morning, I drifted to bed this morning, I drifted to sleep... this morning.

Drift The Night Away is a pieth of trath. If you're a weeb who likes anime dramatizations and visual novels then you'll love this, because that's the focus rather than racing. This is a mobile game that somehow made it onto steam. I swear, if I ever meet the developer IRL, I'm gonna really have to give him a stern talking to. I know it's a male, because women simply aren't capable of creating games like this. This.... this.... this MESS requires the brain of a man. And I mean that in the worst freaking way. You ever download a program, and you click mindlessly through the installer, only to find later it installed a bunch of crap like desktop strippers and Babylon browser? Well, this is the sort of malicious crap that would be stuck in an installer for PC Cleaner McCafe edition. I used to download games off of shady websites as a kid that were better than this. I remember playing this really adult Jaws game that was way more fun than that, and Jaws was naked in it. Think about what I'm saying because I'm never gonna say any of these words in the same combination like this ever again, I'm really not going to allow myself to do that. In all honesty, I don't think I'll allow myself to drive a car ever again, let alone drift. If someone talks about drifting I'm gonna Don Swayze all over them, and put them in an irreversible coma. review:
Doesn't offer the "realistic physics" it claims and the game is broken. You have to pay to repair your vehicle, which is understandable, but when you don't have the money to do so you can't play anymore because there's no other way to make money than by driving. Once you trash your car it's game over and you can't play anymore, unless there's another way but there's literally no tutorial that explains anything. This is an early access title that somehow got released without any playtesting, not to mention even on max settings the game is far less visually appealing than the store page would have someone think. 
I don't rag on a game too often because I feel if a game offers at least enough entertainment as it's worth than I won't complain, but this was an unplayable burden from the moment I saw the GTA-length loading screen.

review:
Al principio, fue raro, debo admitirlo.

Hasta que te acostumbras a los controles, el auto hace lo que quiere y te chocas todo... despues, ya va un poco mejor. Haces un par de misiones, juntas plata, compras performance y... otra vez te tenes que acostumbrar a los controles. Ademas de ir arreglando la parte mecanica, porque si no los cambios no pasan, el auto no arranca, etc.

Es un juego muy entretenido, MUY arcade (si buscas algo de conduccion posta, olvidate). Me hizo acordar mucho al SRS en los controles y su respuesta.

Tiene buenas modificaciones, aunque algo escasas, pero no por eso poco interesantes. Modificaciones visuales, mecanicas y graficas.

En resumen, buen juego para pasar el rato, si sos de los que tienen poca paciencia para acostumbrarse a controles y "ma√±as", este juego no es para vos.

El menu un poco decadente y poco amigable, pero bueno, es solo un menu.

Mal que no tenga "reiniciar" cuando no completas la mision y tengas que buscarla manejando en algun lugar del mapa. Tiene una ruta o carretera de monta√±a muy interesante pero que por alguna extra√±a cuestion no figura en el minimapa.

En fin, un juego independiente, bastante bien logrado (por ser independiente), con el cual pasar el rato... con paciencia.

Hay mucho para mejorar pero no por eso es poco jugable (como ocurre a veces). Y hablando de mucho para mejorar, es importante aclarar que el desarrollador va tirando actualizaciones y fixes de manera constante, un juego muy actualizado y solucionando los peque√±os problemas.

Gracias OtakuMaker por darme la posibilidad de haber ganado este juego.

review:
The game as a whole is broken and the physics need a complete rework.

It seems as if the developers spend more money sponsoring people to showcase their game instead of, you know, developing the game.

This is just a PC port of the FREE mobile game.
All in all, I believe that this game has big flaws and despite even the low(ish) price of $5.49 CAD, even that is a bit of big ask.

Make this a free game and revamp the physics so cars behave somewhat like cars would and maybe you'll have something good but charging for this, admittedly, unpolished game is a joke.

I really wanted to enjoy this game because I like racing/driving/drifting games and this just left a bad taste in my mouth.

If you're thinking of buying this, take a moment to rethink and maybe your money will go better spent than on this "game."

review:
Ok for those out there confused with all the reviews.  Yes the steering wheel and pedals/shifter work. You have to select either controller or keyboard on the main screen on top/middle. The controls need to be mapped before launching the main game. 

I am not a pro drifter, but this game gives you the feel and satisfaction of being on when you pull off a nasty drift.  True there could be more selections of cars and modifications, but so far there is enough to keep you busy. 
This game is somewhat of a grind to get money, but the nice this about it is that you get money doing drifting anywhere. It doesn't matter if you are racing AI or just ripping it up at the airfield on solo mode. 

I give this game a thumbs up because of the fun factor to price ratio. Sure haters will hate, but everyone has the freedom of speech. 

Drift on my fellow gamers!

DSJ Was a great concept for a game... Why did you messed it up?

review:
Do I recommend the game is a yes and no. 

The Pros: It is pretty fun game for the money and if you enjoy cars and drifting It's an okay game OVERALL, however its bad in the sense of how the physics feel, the sway of the cars, the drifting motion, the drifting backwards and zooming off into trees (Check con section). There is a little bit of content to keep yourself entertained.

The Cons: There is a variety of cons for this game. Using a controller is super confusing and almost impossible, Might have to reconfigure yourself. Using a keyboard is just annoying because its either full throttle or nothing. The music is a headache and starts then changes and starts and stops. The sound is meh, it's just not what i was expecting. The feeling of the cars was confusing to much, as such it felt like i was on ice and it was lock diff no matter what with no traction. Sometimes when i over cook a drift it goes into what i call mega speed and i go really fast backwards. It was too easy to make money, I used the ae86 on the first drift track held it together for a long time and recieved i think it was over 150k. Easy to manipulate. 

If the game goes through some updates I will check them out as it is pretty fun to play and will update my review. If you're a dedicated 'car guy' i would say buy it. If you're just after a car game to drive around I would not recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282532232', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1490348999}
review:
Edit in 2018: This review sucks, don't read it.

- No body customization. The cars look like that from the start.
- Upgrades are only decent at best. The game gives you the ability to change the exhaust, pistons and add turbos. That's pretty much it for engines. Not kidding, only those three.
- Not much in the way of settings. For graphics, you can only choose between Low, Med and High. There's also no option for Audio and further controls customization.

[b]Important:[/b]

- [u]You are literally penalized for just playing the game.[/u] The game has a system where you have to pay for engine wear, tyre wear, and fuel. They all go down when you drive the car at all. No, not  when you crash; when you DRIVE. You have to pay for these individually. My minimal pay for drifting is even more subtracted now. The heck am I supposed to buy anything at all?

Maybe this is normal in other games? I only fancy games where I am not limited in something like this. Honestly, the first person who thought penalizing your players for playing your game the way it's supposed to was a good idea should have their loved ones beaten. (Because they are probably equally as douchey.) If the developers wanted realism, work on the physics first.

- [u]Wheel users can go jump off a cliff.[/u] The game countersteers the car for you when drifting in a game ABOUT drifting. There is no option to turn this off. There is also no FFB, at all. So yay.

I'm a wheel user. If I wanted the game to take control of my steering and assuming I'm a GTR fanboy who doesn't actually know how to drift, Christ, I can go to NFS 2015 for that.



If you have a good computer and are looking for a game with nice drifting physics and lots of upgrades and tuning, get Forza you madman. At least on that game the developers doesn't hate you and give the chance to earn money.
If you're looking for realism get Assetto Corsa. (But you're reading this so you're probably aren't.)

Positives? I can't really think of any that isn't already done better by another game. Drifting is okay? Graphics look very nice? Again, if you want pretty pictures get Forza.
